info.title: CX WFM Api (Historical, Forecast and Target)
info.description: CxWFM platform api for handling historical data and generating and storing forecasts.

get.description: Retrieve a set of historical data.

post.description: Add historical data, overlapping data points are overwritten.

delete.description: Delete a range of historical data.

schema.title: Response Get All Tenants  Tenant Id  Forecastscenarios Get

delete.description: Mark a single scenario as deleted.

put.description: Save forecast params to a scenario.

post.description:
Initialize forecast creation.

Kicks off a a new forecast using the params that have been assigned to the
scenario. The forecasting process is initiated and the corresponding data
series are generated as empty entities. The request will return before
finishing the forecasts and a client will have to monitor the data series
to find out when the forecasting process has finished. The request will
fail if there are ongoing forecast jobs running when the request is made.
All existing data series for the scenario will be overwritten. Any content
in the request body will be disregarded.

400.description:
Failure. Possible reasons:
              * If the scenario has any series that are pending (i.e. there
              are ongoing forecast jobs), the request fails.

schema.title: Response Get All Tenants  Tenant Id  Forecastscenarios  Scenario Id  Series Get

post.description: Add a new forecast data series.

get.description: Retrieve a single forecast data series.

schema.title: Response Get All Tenants  Tenant Id  Forecasttimelines Get

get.description: Retrieve all scenarios for a timeline.

schema.title: Response Get Timeline Scenarios Tenants  Tenant Id  Forecasttimelines  Forecast Timeline Id  Scenarios Get

post.description:
Add a forecast scenario to a timeline.

When a forecast scenario is added to a timeline it means that the
forecast series of that scenario will be used as part of the timeline
and therefore be the source for scheduling based on the timeline. Adding
a scenario to a timeline will fail if the timeline already contains a
time series for the same combination of competency, channel and direction
for the same time period. If the forecast for a scenario is re-run after
it has been added to the scenario the data used in the timeline will be
updated.

delete.description:
Delete a single scenario from timeline.

Deleting a forecast will simultaneously delete the forecast's data series
and adjustments.

schema.title: Response Get All Tenants  Tenant Id  Forecasttimeline  Forecast Timeline Id  Adjustments Get

post.description:
Add new adjustment.

Adjustments are required to have a start date time,
that matches the chosen interval length. This check
is performed in the timezone of the tenant.

For example can hour adjustments start on whole hours,
while day adjustments should be placed at 0:00.

400.description:
Failure, possible reasons:

                     startDateTime missing timezone specification.

post.description:
Retrieve the data series for a timeline.

Based on the input parameters this endpoint will return the data series
for a timeline. If adjustments are stacked (i.e. more than one adjustment
is applied to an interval), any percentage-based adjustment is applied
before absolute adjustments.

The start and end date in the query is in the tenant timezone, i.e.,
timestamps will be relative to the tenants timezone. Timestamps represent
the start of the interval.

schema.title: Response Timeline Series Queries Tenants  Tenant Id  Forecasttimelines  Timeline Id  Series Query Post

ForecastTimelineSeriesDataSeriesDTO.title: ForecastTimelineSeriesDataSeriesDTO
ForecastTimelineSeriesDataSeriesDTO.description:
The actual data series part of a timeline series.

Parameters
----------
nco:
    Number of Calls Offered, here used also for non-call
    interactions. A more suitable name could be
    "number of interactions offered".
aht:
    Average Handling Time, expressed in seconds.

ForecastTimelineSeriesQueryDTO.description: Query input for getting timeline data series.

HistoricalDataDTO.description: The historical data that should be stored.

MetricType.title: MetricType
MetricType.description: The type of data in a series.

NewForecastSeriesDTO.description: Represent dto model for input requests.

NewForecastTimelineDTO.title: NewForecastTimelineDTO
NewForecastTimelineDTO.description: Represent dto model for input requests.

TimeSeriesDTO.description: Represent the DTO-model for an Time Series.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description:
Routes for managing historical data.

Historical data is data about historical interaction
volumes and patterns aggregated into 15-minute intervals.Historical
data is collected from an ACD and used to create the forecasts that
are the basis for future schedules.

tags.name: Forecast Timeline
tags.description:
Routes for managing forecast timelines.

A forecast timeline is a continuous timeline of
forecast scenarios that can be used as the data source for schedule
generation and optimization. A tenant can have multiple forecast
timelines to allow customers to schedule based on different scenarios
or for different segments of the contact center.

tags.name: Forecast Scenario
tags.description:
Routes for managing forecast scenarios.

A forecast scenario is the result of forecast
future workloads an interaction patterns for a specific time interval
and combination of competencies, channels and directions.

tags.name: Forecast Series
tags.description:
Routes for managing forecast data series.

The Forecast series contains the actual data for a
forecast metric. One forecast object can contain multiple data series
where these series must cover differe, non-overlapping, time ranges.
The data series are provided with a forecasted value per 15-minute
period. The data is per day type (e.g. weekday) and split into two
segments:
* First, the curve is the distribution of forecasted values
(e.g. interactions) over one day's (24 hours) quarters.
The sum of all values on the curve is always 1.0. The curve will
always contain 96 values (one per quarter-hour).
* Second, the dayValues is the total number forecasted for one day.

tags.name: Adjustment
tags.description:
Routes for managing forecast adjustments.

Adjustments are changes to the forecasted values
that are applied when the forecast is used to optimize a schedule.
Adjustments can be made at different intervals (quarter-hour, hourly,
daily, monthly or yearly) and when applied it will update all values within
that interval. The type of update can be set either as a percentage of
existing values or as an absolute value. If set as an absolute value
over anything else than a quarter-hour interval, the value will be
distributed over the whole interval. Adjustments can be stacked (i.e.
multiple adjustments can be applied to an interval) and they can also
overlap. When overlapping, percentage-based adjustments will be applied
first.
